title.narrative: ALIGNING LAWS, POLICIES AND PROTOCOLS

description.narrative: Output 2.2: Legislation, policies and protocols (including respective accountabilities) related to VAC are aligned across health, education and justice systems, legally enforced and regularly monitored., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Children, especially those in difficult life circumstances, suffer, witness and practice less psychological and physical maltreatment, including all forms of harm, abuse, neglect, and exploitation at home, in school, in care, in custody and in public spaces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: Legislation, policies and protocols (including respective accountabilities) related to VAC are aligned across health,education and justice systems, legally enforced and regularly monitored.

description.narrative: The Government of Kazakhstan has adopted the ‘2020-2023 Roadmap for Strengthening Protection of Children, Addressing Domestic Violence and Preventing Suicides Among Adolescents’ focusing on prohibition of corporal punishment of children by law, awareness raising on violence against children, development of parenting clubs, strengthening inter-agency response to violence against children, prevention of injuries. UNICEF’s support was extended to VAC admin data analysis, testing of standard operating procedures in response to VAC in health and education and protection of children affected by migration among local service providers. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.

baseline.value: Key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex, are not collected by education, social and health sector, collected by police without full disaggregation

target.value: 2020:education, social protection, health and justice sectors establish the mechanisms for routine collection and publication of key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.

actual.value: 2020:Recommendations for strengthening admin data on VAC were discussed with national stakeholders.

title.narrative: Quality of legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non-discrimination for children, regardless of their migratory status

baseline.value: Quality of legal frameworks are not equity focused in relation to: child immigration detention care arrangements for refugee and migrant children guardianship system (for both migrant children and children left behind) access to health for all chi

target.value: 2020:quality of legal frameworks are equity focused in relation to: •child immigration detention •care arrangements for refugee and migrant children

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF continued advocacy following the amendments of legislation in Kazakhstan, in particular the Code on Marriage and Family (Dec 2019), to prevent childhood statelessness and ensure that all children born in the country are registered at birth and issu

title.narrative: Status of a legal and normative frameworks enabling reporting and referral (between sectors) of VAC cases(62404)

baseline.value: The current legal and normative framework does not fully enable reporting and referral between sectors

target.value: 2020:national authorities adopt a legal and normative framework enabling reporting, appropriate referral of cases of VAC across sectors, and resource enforcement of VAC-related legislation.

actual.value: 2020:Inter-agency algorithm was issued by MOES as recommended document. Draft SOPs for health specialists on identification and responding to VAC was adopted with UNICEF support. SOP for education specialists was tested. New draft law on Prevention of Domest
